description: Construction of part single, part two storey rear extensions and change of use of building from police station (Use Class Sui Generis) to residential (Use Class C3) to accommodate five flats (three two-bedroom flats, two three-bedroom flats) and construction of three three-bedroom detached dwellinghouses; provision of 8 car parking spaces, cycle and refuse storage; private and community amenity (following demolition of 6 outbuildings)
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.  REASON:	In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing title numbers Location Plan, 01F, 02F, 04F, 05F, 06F, 07F received 9th May 2012, and 03G, 08G received 20th June 2012, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the local Planning Authority.  REASON: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning. | Samples of the materials to be used for the external surfaces (including windows), of the development shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before any part of the development is commenced, and this condition shall apply notwithstanding any indications as to these matters which have been given in this application.  Development shall be carried out in accordance with these approved details.  REASON:	In the interest of securing a high quality development and to ensure that the resulting appearance and construction of the development preserves the character of the Locally listed building and  the visual amenity of the Norwood Green Conservation Area as a whole in accordance with the National Planning Policy Framework, policies 3.5, 7.4, 7.6 and 7.8 of the London Plan 2011 and policies 4.1, 4.7, 4.8 and 5.5 of the adopted Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | The residential units hereby approved shall be constructed to meet Lifetime Homes Standards.  REASON: To ensure access for all for future occupiers in accordance with policy 7.2 of the London Plan 2011 and policy 5.3 of the adopted Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | Notwithstanding the provisions of Classes A, B, C, D E and F of Part 1 of Schedule 2 to the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 1995 (amended 2008),  no enlargement, improvement or other alteration to the dwellinghouses hereby approved shall be carried out without the prior permission of the Local Planning Authority, obtained through the submission of a planning application.  REASON:	To prevent the overdevelopment of the site and to safeguard the living conditions of adjoining properties and visual appearance of the buildings and Norwood Green Conservation Area, in accordance with policies 3.5, 7.4, 7.6 and 7.8 of the London Plan 2011 and policies 4.1, 4.8 and 5.5 of the adopted Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | The windows hereby approved to the flank elevation facing Frogmore Court in House 2, as labelled in the approved plans, shall be non-opening and obscured glazed, and shall be maintained as such thereafter.   REASON: To ensure the privacy of neighbouring properties is maintained in accordance with policies 7.4 and 7.6 of the London plan 2011 and policies 4.1 and 5.5 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, Plan for the Environment (2004). | The development hereby approved shall comply with the aims and objectives of 'Secured by Design'.   REASON:  To ensure the safety of future residents, and to ensure that the proposed development achieves the required crime prevention elements in accordance with adopted Unitary development Plan policies 4.1, 4.4 and 5.5 of the of the adopted Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and the Council's Supplementary Guidance 08 ' Safer Ealing'. | The car parking spaces shown on the approved plans shall be marked out on the site prior to first occupation of any part of the development, and these spaces shall be kept continuously available for car parking and shall not be used for any other purpose. 	 REASON:	To ensure that there is adequate provision for car parking within the site, in accordance with policy 6.13 of the London Plan 2011 and policy 9.1 of the Adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | Notwithstanding any information submitted with this application, details for the provision of four secure cycle parking spaces shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority before the first occupation of the development hereby permitted. Such details as approved shall be implemented and brought into use prior to first occupation, and retained for the lifetime of the development. 	 REASON:	To ensure that there is adequate provision for cycle parking within the site, in accordance with policy 6.13 of the London Plan 2011. | No part of the roof of the ground floor rear extension hereby shall be used as or altered to form a balcony, roof garden, roof terrace or similar amenity area.  REASON:  To protect the living conditions of occupants of the adjoining property at no.188 Norwood Road, in accordance with policies 7.1 and 7.4, of the London Plan 2011 and 4.1, 5.5 of the Adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | No occupation of the residential units hereby approved shall take place until full details of hard/soft landscape works of the site's frontage and communal areas, and all boundary/enclosure treatments, including a phased programme of works, have been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority and these works shall be completed as approved prior to the first occupation of any part of the development or in accordance with the programme agreed by the Local Planning Authority.  Any trees or other plants which die or are removed within the first five years following the implementation of the landscaping scheme shall be replaced during the next planting season.  REASON:  To ensure that the development is satisfactorily landscaped in the interests of the visual character and appearance of the locally listed building and the Norwood Green Cosnervation Area as a whole, and in accordance with policies 3.5 and 7.4 of the London Plan 2011 and policies 4.1, 4.5 and 5.5 of the adopted Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | Existing trees in adjoining land and in close proximity/ adjoining the boundaries of the site shall not be lopped, felled or otherwise affected in any way (including raising or lowering soil levels under the crown spread of the trees) and no excavation shall be cut under the crown spread of the trees and  area beneath the spread of their branches shall not be used for the storage of building materials, plant, machinery or other items, or for vehicular access or for the burning of materials of any kind without the prior written permission of the Local Planning Authority.  REASON:	To safeguard the trees in the interest of visual character and appearance of the Norwood Green Conservation Area in accordance with the objectives of policies 7.4, 7.8 and 7.21 of the London Plan 2011 and policies 4.1, 4.5, 4.8 and 5.5 of the Council's adopted Unitary Development Plan 'The Plan for the Environment' 2004 and Supplementary Planning Guidance 9 'Trees and Development Guidelines'. | No development (including initial site-clearance) shall commence until a detailed scheme for the protection of trees, hedgerows and groups of mature shrubs in adjoining land, in accordance with British Standard 5837:2005 'Trees In Relation To Construction Recommendations' (or any subsequent revision), has been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  Protection measures shall be phased as necessary to take into account and provide protection during demolition/site clearance works, all construction works and hard landscaping works.  Details shall include the following:   a)	Accurate trunk positions and canopy spreads of all existing trees within the site and on adjoining land adjacent to the development.  b)	Positions and spreads of existing hedgerows and groups of mature shrubs.  c)	All proposed tree, hedge, shrub removal and retention.  d)	Increased 'Root Protection Areas' of all existing retained trees within the site and on neighbouring land adjacent to the approved development, calculated in accordance with guidance 5.24 of BS 5837:2005 recommendations.  e)	Plans of a minimum scale of 1:200 (unless agreed otherwise by the Local Authority) showing the proposed locations and height of protective barrier/s, supported by a metal scaffold framework, constructed in accordance with Section 9 (Figure 2), to include appropriate weatherproof tree protection area signage (such as "Keep Out - Construction Exclusion Zone") securely fixed to the outside of the protective fencing structure at regular intervals.  f)	Proposed ground protection measures in accordance with Section 9 (Figure 3)  g)	Annotated minimum distances between fencing and trunks of retained trees at regular intervals.  h)	Illustration/s of the proposed fencing structure/s to be erected.  i)	All underground services, soak-a-ways, utilities and drainage as well as storage sites of spoil heaps, site cabins and material storage, temporary haul roads and access etc.   REASON:       To safeguard the trees in the interest of visual character and appearance of the Norwood Green Conservation Area in accordance with the objectives of policies 7.4, 7.8 and 7.21 of the London Plan 2011 and policies 4.1, 4.5, 4.8 and 5.5 of the Council's adopted Unitary Development Plan 'The Plan for the Environment' 2004 and Supplementary Planning Guidance 9 'Trees and Development Guidelines'. | The provision of the sedum roof  shall be fully completed prior to the first occupation of any of the flats hereby approved, and shall be permanently retained.  REASON:	To safeguard biodiversity levels and the character adna ppearace of the locally listed building and the visual amenities of the Norwood Green Conservation area,  in accordance with the objectives of the National Planning Policy Framework, policies 4.1, 4.5 and 5.5 of the Council's Adopted Uniary Development Plan 'The Plan for the Environment' (2004). | Details of a drainage scheme for the site (including surface water drainage), based on sustainable drainage principles shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to the commencement of the development. The development shall be implemented only as approved and retained thereafter, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  REASON: To ensure the drainage measures comply with Thames Water/Environment Agency requirements, and to prevent the increased risk of flooding, to improve and protect water quality and ensure future maintenance of these in accordance with the National _Planning Policy Framework, policies 5.12 and 5.13 of the London Plan 2011 and policy  2.5 of the Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | The refuse storage shown on the approved plans shall be made available for use prior to first occupation of any part of the development, and this space shall not be used for any other purpose. 	 REASON:	To ensure that there is adequate provision for refuse storage within the site, in accordance with policies 4.1 and 2.10 of the Adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and Supplementary Planning Guidance 04 'Refuse and Recycling Facilities'. | Notwithstanding any information submitted with the application and prior to the commencement of the development hereby approved, details of the BS4142 rating noise, the predicted vibration levels and mitigation works with windows closed and other means of ventilation provided to protect habitable rooms of flats 1, 3, 4, 5 and House 1 from external noise shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority.  The approved details shall be fully implemented prior to the first occupation of the building and retained thereafter.  REASON:  To protect occupiers of the residential units  from noise as the development will be affected by traffic noise, in accordance with policy 7.15 of the London Plan 2011 and policies 4.1, 5.5 and  4.11 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and Supplementary Planning Guidance SPG 10: 'Noise and Vibration'. | Notwithstanding any information submitted with the application and prior to the commencement of the development hereby approved, details of air pollutant levels and a scheme of mitigation measures to protect habitable rooms of flats 1, 3, 4, 5 and House 1 shall be submitted to and approved by the local planning authority. The approved details shall be fully implemented prior to the first occupation of the building and retained thereafter.  REASON:  To protect occupiers of the residential units  from air pollutants as the development will be affected by high levels of traffic, in accordance with policy 7.14 of the London Plan 2011 and policies 4.1, 5.5 and 2.6 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004).
